From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin variāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [bə.ɾiˈa]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [və.ɾiˈa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [va.ɾiˈaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

variar (first-person singular present vario, first-person singular preterite varií, past participle variat)

  1. (ambitransitive) to vary

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of variar (first conjugation)
infinitive variar
gerund variant
past participle masculine feminine
singular variat variada
plural variats variades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present vario varies varia variem varieu varien
imperfect variava variaves variava variàvem variàveu variaven
future variaré variaràs variarà variarem variareu variaran
preterite varií variares varià variàrem variàreu variaren
conditional variaria variaries variaria variaríem variaríeu variarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present variï variïs variï variem varieu variïn
imperfect variés variessis variés variéssim variéssiu variessin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — varia variï variem varieu variïn
negative (no) — no variïs no variï no variem no varieu no variïn

Synonyms

[edit]
  • (to cause to vary): modificar, diversificar
  • (to vary): modificar-se

Related terms

[edit]
  • variable
  • variació
  • variància
  • variant
  • variat

Further reading

[edit]
  • “variar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Learned borrowing from Latin variāre, variō.

Verb

[edit]

variar (first-person singular present varío, first-person singular preterite variei, past participle variado)
variar (first-person singular present vario, first-person singular preterite variei, past participle variado, reintegrationist norm)

  1. to vary

Related terms

[edit]
  • variación

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin variāre (“to vary”), from varius (“various; different”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /va.ɾiˈa(ʁ)/ [va.ɾɪˈa(h)], (faster pronunciation) /vaˈɾja(ʁ)/ [vaˈɾja(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /va.ɾiˈa(ʁ)/ [va.ɾɪˈa(h)], (faster pronunciation) /vaˈɾja(ʁ)/ [vaˈɾja(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /va.ɾiˈa(ɾ)/ [va.ɾɪˈa(ɾ)], (faster pronunciation) /vaˈɾja(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /va.ɾiˈa(ʁ)/ [va.ɾɪˈa(χ)], (faster pronunciation) /vaˈɾja(ʁ)/ [vaˈɾja(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /va.ɾiˈa(ɻ)/ [va.ɾɪˈa(ɻ)], (faster pronunciation) /vaˈɾja(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /vɐˈɾjaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /vɐˈɾjaɾ/
    • (Northern Portugal) IPA(key): /bɐˈɾjaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /vɐˈɾja.ɾi/

  • Homophone: varear (Portugal)
  • Hyphenation: va‧ri‧ar

Verb

[edit]

variar (first-person singular present vario, first-person singular preterite variei, past participle variado)

  1. to vary (to change with time or a similar parameter)
  2. to vary (to institute a change in)
    Synonyms: alterar, modificar, mudar
  3. (grammar) to inflect (to vary the form of a word)
    Synonym: flexionar-se

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of variar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person

Future variarei variarás variará variaremos variareis variarão

Future variar variares variar variarmos variardes variarem
Imperative
Affirmative varia varie variemos variai variem
Negative (não) não varies não varie não variemos não varieis não variem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Synonyms

[edit]
  • (to change): alterar, modificar(-se), mudar, mutar

Antonyms

[edit]
  • (antonym(s) of “to change”): manter-se

Derived terms

[edit]
  • variável

Related terms

[edit]
  • variabilidade
  • variação
  • variadamente
  • variado
  • variador
  • variagem
  • variamente
  • variância
  • variante
  • variavelmente
  • variedade
  • vário
  • vários

Further reading

[edit]
  • “variar”, in Dicionário Aulete Digital (in Portuguese), Rio de Janeiro: Lexikon Editora Digital, 2008–2025
  • “variar”, in Dicionário inFormal (in Portuguese), 2006–2025
  • “variar” in Dicionário Aberto based on Novo Diccionário da Língua Portuguesa de Cândido de Figueiredo, 1913
  • “variar”, in Dicionário infopédia da Lingua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Porto: Porto Editora, 2003–2025
  • “variar”, in Michaelis Dicionário Brasileiro da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), São Paulo: Editora Melhoramentos, 2015–2025
  • “variar”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin variāre, variō.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /baˈɾjaɾ/ [baˈɾjaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: va‧riar

Verb

[edit]

variar (first-person singular present varío, first-person singular preterite varié, past participle variado)

  1. to alter, vary, change

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of variar (i-í alternation) (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive variar
gerund variando
past participle masculine feminine
singular variado variada
plural variados variadas
singular plural
1st person 2nd person 3rd person 1st person 2nd person 3rd person
indicative yo tú
vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ellos/ellas
ustedes
present varío varíastú
variásvos 		varía variamos variáis varían
imperfect variaba variabas variaba variábamos variabais variaban
preterite varié variaste varió variamos variasteis variaron
future variaré variarás variará variaremos variaréis variarán
conditional variaría variarías variaría variaríamos variaríais variarían
subjunctive yo tú
vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros

vosotras 		ellos/ellas
ustedes

variésvos2 		varíe variemos variéis varíen

vos 		usted nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros

affirmative varíatú
variávos 		varíe variemos variad varíen
negative no varíes no varíe no variemos no variéis no varíen

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
